turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Where are you meeting this person?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: The Zoo. They have a pretty good one here, do they?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh. Well, I haven't either. I might just ride out there with you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Where did he say he was going to meet you?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I thought he said by the monkey house.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Benjamin -- I would like to know what you're doing here.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well, I have this very pleasant room on Carter Street -- and I've been getting to some classes --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No. I just sit in. They don't seem to mind. They've been very congenial about it.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Benjamin -- you're -- I don't know what to say -- you're --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Maybe we could get together some time and talk about it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I've got a real feeling that this is the fellow.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I want to ask you a question.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: No. I want to know why you're here in Berkeley?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I said I think it is.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well, I want you to leave.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: How could you do that, Benjamin?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Do you just hate everything? How could you possibly rape my...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- how you -- how anyone -- could do a thing like that.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You've got to tell me what she said.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: She said she was having a drink in the hotel with a friend. You waited for her in the parking lot and told her she was too drunk to drive home and that you would get her a room for the night.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Then you took her upstairs and you raped her.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Elaine -- that is not what happened.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: All right -- but listen to me. What happened was there was this party at my parents. I drove your mother home -- then we went upstairs to see your portrait --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: -- and when we got up in the room she starts taking her her clothes off -- and --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: -- suddenly there she was without any clothes on -- I mean really naked --

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Benjamin, when you came up here, what did you think was going to happen between us?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Elaine -- right now I don't feel like talking much. I'm sorry about everything but I think I'll just do this now.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Can I just sit here while you're packing?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No. I have two. The other one is the one I'm looking for.  What's this?  It's from my grandmother.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: The belt I'm looking for was from my grandmother.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: What are you going to do now?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I don't want you to leave tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I don't want you to go anywhere until you have a definite plan.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Is that so? You might marry me?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: How about tomorrow? I don't mean to be pushy but --

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I don't know. I don't know what's happening.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well -- look -- don't be confused. We're getting married.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I don't see how we can.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I have to go back now.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Elaine -- are you serious about this?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: We could go down and get our blood tests tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Or this afternoon. It's a good day for it.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Benjamin -- I haven't even said I'll marry you yet.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: We'll need our Birth Certificates. I happen to have mine with me. Where's yours?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I just don't think it would work.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I just don't think it would...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Why don't you just drag me off if you want to marry me so much?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Why don't I just drag you off? All right -- I will. Right after we get the blood tests.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well -- I have to see Carl first.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Carl Smith. He's a medical student. We've known him for years.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Who -- that guy at the Zoo?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Why do you have to see him?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well -- I said I might marry him.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: How did he do it? Did he get down on his knees? He didn't get down on his knees, I hope.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well, what did he say? I'm curious.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: He said he thought we'd make a pretty good team.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Maybe we are and maybe we aren't.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: This is Dr. Smith's answering service.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Well -- you see -- the doctor is at his son's wedding, but I'm sure it's over by now. He should be checking in any moment --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Listen to me. I am Dr. Smith's brother -- Reverend Smith -- and I am supposed to perform the ceremony. I just got in -- from -- Portland -- and I've forgotten what church -- you see?

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Oh.  Well -- I'm not sure -- but you might try the First Presbyterian. That's on Allan Street.

turns.speaker: MR. MCQUIRE
turns.text: Ben -- I just want to say one word to you -- just one word --

turns.speaker: MR. MCQUIRE
turns.text: There is a great future in plastics. Think about it. Will you think about it?

turns.speaker: MR. MCQUIRE
turns.text: Okay. Enough said. That's a deal.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well -- I'm just sort of traveling through.

turns.speaker: MR. MCCLEERY
turns.text: I like to know who's living in my house. I like to know what my boys are up to.

turns.speaker: MR. MCCLEERY
turns.text: You're not one of those agitators?

turns.speaker: MR. MCCLEERY
turns.text: I hate that. I won't stand for it.

turns.speaker: MR. MCCLEERY
turns.text: Screaming isn't all right. Not in my house it isn't.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It was just a visitor. But it's all right now.

turns.speaker: MR. MCCLEERY
turns.text: What did you do to her?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Look -- she's all right. She's upset and she screamed. But she's okay now.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: See -- she's just having some water. Now there's no need for the cops or anything.

turns.speaker: MR. MCCLEERY
turns.text: All right, boys -- I think you can get back to your rooms. I don't think we'll have any more of this agitation. Will we, Braddock?

turns.speaker: MR. MCCLEERY
turns.text: You heard me. Out of here.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mr. McCleery -- do you have some change? I need to use the phone?

turns.speaker: MR. MCCLEERY
turns.text: I want you out of here.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Look -- I'll give you ten dollars for a dime -- I'll give you twenty -- for God's sake, will you let me use that phone?

turns.speaker: MR. MCCLEERY
turns.text: I am going to call the police now.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Could I make one phone call first?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON'S VOICE
turns.text: Will you bring up my purse before you go?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I have to go now. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well I'll hand it to you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Come to the railing and I'll hand it up.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON'S VOICE
turns.text: Benjamin -- I am getting pretty tired of all this suspicion. Now if you won't do me a simple favor I don't know what.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm putting it on the top step.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON'S VOICE
turns.text: For God's sake, Benjamin, will you stop acting that way and bring me the purse?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm putting it here by the door.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON'S VOICE
turns.text: Will you bring it in to me?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON'S VOICE
turns.text: All right. Put it in the room where we were.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mrs. Robinson -- I don't quite know how to put this --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Look -- I was thinking about that time after the party --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: -- and I was wondering if I could buy you a drink or something --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No. Now I know it's pretty late and if you'd rather --

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON'S VOICE
turns.text: I'll be there in an hour.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: A room. I'd like a room, please.

turns.speaker: ROOM CLERK
turns.text: A single room or a double room?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: A single. Just for myself, please.

turns.speaker: ROOM CLERK
turns.text: Will you sign the register, please?

turns.speaker: ROOM CLERK
turns.text: Do you have any luggage, Mister --  Gladstone?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well it's in the car. It's out in the car.

turns.speaker: ROOM CLERK
turns.text: Very good, sir. I'll have a porter bring it in.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I mean I'd -- I'd rather not go to the trouble of bringing it all in. I just have a toothbrush. I can get it myself. If that's all right.

turns.speaker: ROOM CLERK
turns.text: I'll have a porter show you the room.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh. Well actually, I'd just as soon find it myself. I just have the toothbrush to carry up and I think I can manage it myself.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Oh. I guess this isn't the bathroom, is it?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Fine, thank you. The bathroom is down at the end of the hall.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Is there an ashtray in here?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Oh -- I forgot. The track star doesn't smoke.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Whatever it is you're upset about.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh -- no. I'm just sort of disturbed about things.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Benjamin, I want to ask you something.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: My husband took the car. Will you drive me home?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: I want you to come in till I get the lights on.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Because I don't feel safe until I get the lights on.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Would you mind walking ahead of me to the sun porch. I feel funny about coming into a dark house.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: But it's light in there now.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Look -- I drove you home. I was glad to do it. But I have some things on my mind. Can you understand that?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Benjamin -- I'm sorry to be this way, but I don't want to be alone in this house.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Please wait till my husband gets home.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Are you always this much afraid of being alone?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well, why can't you just lock the doors and go to bed?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: What do you think of me?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: You've known me nearly all of your life. You must have formed some opinion.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well -- I've always thought that you were a very -- nice -- person.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Did you know I was an alcoholic?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Look -- I think I should be going --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mrs. Robinson -- if you don't mind my saying so -- this conversation is getting a little strange. Now I'm sure that Mr. Robinson will be here any minute and --

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: My husband will be back quite late.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh no, Mrs. Robinson, oh no.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mrs. Robinson, you didn't -- I mean you didn't expect --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I mean -- you didn't really think that I would do something like that.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: For God's sake, Mrs. Robinson, here we are, you've got me into your house. You give me a drink. You put on music, now you start opening up your personal life to me and tell me your husband won't be home for hours.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mrs. Robinson -- you are trying to seduce me.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Why no. I hadn't thought of it. I feel rather flattered that you --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mrs. Robinson, will you forgive me for what I just said?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's not all right, it's the worst thing I've ever said to anyone.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Please forgive me. Because I like you. I don't think of you that way. But I'm mixed up.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: All right. Now finish your drink.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mrs. Robinson, it makes me sick that I said that to you.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: We'll forget it right now. Finish your drink.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Have you ever seen Elaine's portrait?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: We had it done last Christmas. Would you like to see it?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I don't remember her as having brown eyes.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: I think I'll go to bed.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: If you still think I'm trying to seduce you --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No, I don't. But I just feel a little funny.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Benjamin -- you've known me all your life.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: What are you so scared of?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Then why do you keep running away?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Because you're going to bed. I don't think I should be up here.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Haven't you ever seen anybody in a slip before?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: But I just -- Look -- what if Mr. Robinson walked in right now?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well, it would look pretty funny, wouldn't it?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Don't you think he trusts us together?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Of course he does. But he might get the wrong idea. Anyone might.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: I don't see why. I'm twice as old as you are. How could anyone think --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: But they would! Don't you see?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Benjamin -- I'm not trying to seduce you. I wish you'd --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I know that. But please, Mrs. Robinson. This is difficult for me.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Because I am confused about things. I can't tell what I'm imagining. I can't tell what's real. I can't --

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Would you like me to seduce you?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Is that what you're trying to tell me?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm going home now. I apologize for what I said. I hope you can forget it. But I'm going home right now.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: I really don't want to put this on again. Won't you bring it up?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: On that chair in the hall.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: I want to say something first.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Benjamin -- I want you to know I'm available to you. If you won't sleep with me this time --

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: If you won't sleep with me this time, Benjamin, I want you to know you can call me up any time you want and we'll make some kind of arrangement.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Do you understand what I said?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Because I find you very attractive and any time --

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Thank you for taking me home.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: You don't have to be so nervous, you know.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Nervous. Well, I am a bit nervous. I mean it's -- it's pretty hard to be suave when you're --

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Did you get us a room?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Have you gotten us a room yet?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well -- I don't. I mean I could. Or we could just talk.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Do you want me to get it?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You? Oh no. No. I'll get it.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Do you want to get it now?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Why don't I get it? Well -- I will then.  If you'll excuse me.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: But there's one thing. The desk clerk seemed to be a little bit suspicious. I mean -- I don't know what their policy is -- but --

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Well -- do you want to go up first?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes -- I think that would be good.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: I'll be up in five minutes.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Isn't there something you want to tell me?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well -- I want you to know how much I appreciate this -- really --

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: The room number, Benjamin. I think you ought to tell me that.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh? You're absolutely right. Absolutely. It's 512.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You're welcome. Well -- I'll see you later, Mrs. Robinson.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: I'll get undressed now. Is that all right?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sure. Shall I -- I mean shall I just stand here? I mean -- I don't know what you want me to do.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Will you bring me a hanger?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Wood or wire? They have both.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Would this be easier for you in the dark?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mrs. Robinson -- I can't do this.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Benjamin -- do you find me undesirable?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh no, Mrs. Robinson. I think -- I think you're the most attractive of all my parents' friends. I just don't think we could possibly --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No -- but look -- maybe we could do something else together, Mrs. Robinson -- would you like to go to a movie.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Benjamin, is this your first time?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: It is, isn't it? It is your first time.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: That's a laugh, Mrs. Robinson. That's really a laugh. Ha ha.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: You can admit that, can't you?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: It's nothing to be ashamed of --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Who said it was my first time?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: -- of bring -- inadequate -- I mean just because you happen to be inadequate in one way --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Now -- do you think we could say a few words to each other first this time?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Good. I mean are we dead or something?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Well I just don't think we have much to say to each other.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: All we ever do is come up here and throw off the clothes and leap into bed together.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm not. No. But do you think we could liven it up with a few words now and then?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Well what do you want to talk about?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Do you want to tell me about some of your college experiences?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mrs. Robinson. If that's the best we can do let's just get the goddamn clothes off and --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Leave it on! Now we are going to do this thing. We are going to have a conversation. Think of another topic.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Art. That's a good subject. You start it off.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: You start it off. I don't know anything about it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes I do. I know quite a bit about it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Art. Well what do you want to know about it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Are you interested more in modern art or more in classical art.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Then why do you want to talk about it?

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Can I take off my clothes now?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No. Think of another topic. Tell me what you did today.

turns.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
turns.text: Do you really want me to?
